headline.main: Race Prejudice Is Deplored; But Mrs. Buck's Citing of Nehru Is Viewed as Unfortunate

lead_paragraph: TO THE EDITOR OF THE NEW YORK TIMES: There will surely be general appreciation by right-thinking men and women of Mrs. Pearl Buck's noble argument against race prejudice throughout the world. It is a pity that she disfigures it by a mistaken comparison between the alleged treatment of American Negroes and that of Pundit Nehru.
